remarks: If two structures have the same group components (properties), one is a commutative ring iff the other one is.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)
statement:
ringpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
ringpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
ringpropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
ringpropd.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` L ) y ) ) $.
crngpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. CRing <-> L e. CRing ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d ph x y $.
